00026 #include <GisCommon.h>
00027 #include <geometry/GeometryStd.h>
00028 /// \brief
00029 ///  
00030 /// The GisGeometryFactoryAbstract class is a factory (abstract, non-pure) for Geometry objects and Geometry helper objects.
00031 class GisGeometryFactoryAbstract : public GisIDisposable
00032 {
00033 public:
00034 
00035     /// Position
00036 
00037     /// \brief
00038     ///  Creates a position object using X and Y ordinates.
00039     /// 
00040     /// \remarks
00041     ///  The resulting object's accessor methods for ordinates
00042     /// that are not given here as input parameters will return the default
00043     /// value of 0.0.
00044     /// 
00045     /// \param x 
00046     /// Input X ordinate value
00047     /// \param y 
00048     /// Input Y ordinate value
00049     /// 
00050     /// \return
00051     /// Returns a direct position
00052     /// 
00053     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIDirectPosition* CreatePositionXY(
00054         double x,
00055         double y);               
00056 
00057     /// \brief
00058     ///  Creates a position object using X, Y and Z ordinates.
00059     /// 
00060     /// \remarks
00061     ///  The resulting object's accessor methods for ordinates
00062     /// that are not given here as input parameters will return the default
00063     /// value of 0.0.
00064     /// 
00065     /// \param x 
00066     /// Input X ordinate value
00067     /// \param y 
00068     /// Input Y ordinate value
00069     /// \param z 
00070     /// Input Z ordinate value
00071     /// 
00072     /// \return
00073     /// Returns a direct position
00074     /// 
00075     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIDirectPosition* CreatePositionXYZ(
00076         double x, 
00077         double y,
00078         double z);
00079 
00080     /// \brief

00099         double x,

00140     /// Envelope
00141 
00142     /// \brief
00143     ///  Creates an envelope object using two positions.
00144     /// 
00145     /// \param lowerLeft 
00146     /// Input lower-left position
00147     /// \param upperRight 
00148     /// Input upper-right position
00149     /// 
00150     /// \return
00151     /// Returns an envelope
00152     /// 
00153     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIEnvelope* CreateEnvelope(
00154         GisIDirectPosition * lowerLeft,
00155         GisIDirectPosition * upperRight);
00156

00162     /// \param ordinates 
00163     /// Input ordinate array representing two positions

00204     /// \param upperRightY

00264     /// Geometry
00265 
00266     /// \brief
00267     ///  Creates a Geometry object by copying from another Geometry.
00268     /// 
00269     /// \remarks
00270     ///  This is a pseudo-copy-constructor.
00271     /// It is required that any implementation use only public methods on the underlying 
00272     /// Geometry object, thus enabling conversion from geometries of the same (or any
00273     /// other) implementation of this Geometry package.
00274     /// 
00275     /// \param geometry 
00276     /// Input Source geometry
00277     /// 
00278     /// \return
00279     /// Returns an envelope
00280     /// 
00281     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIGeometry * CreateGeometry(
00282         GisIGeometry * geometry) = 0;
00283 
00284     /// \brief
00285     ///  Creates a Geometry object by converting from a text string.
00286     /// 
00287     /// \remarks
00288     ///  While this method is not pure virtual, its default implementation will
00289     /// throw an exception if called.  A concrete, derived class should override this
00290     /// method if conversion from text is required.
00291     /// 
00292     /// \param text 
00293     /// Input Source geometry text
00294     /// 
00295     /// \return
00296     /// Returns a Geometry
00297     /// 
00298     GISGEOM_API GisIGeometry * CreateGeometry(
00299         GisString* text);
00300 
00301     /// \brief
00302     ///  Creates a Geometry object by converting from an envelope.
00303     /// 
00304     /// \remarks
00305     ///  This method will produce a new Geometry 
00306     /// based on the given envelope.  The actual geometry type produced is implementation-dependent.
00307     /// 
00308     /// \param envelope 
00309     /// Input Source envelope
00310     /// 
00311     /// \return
00312     /// Returns a Geometry
00313     /// 
00314     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIGeometry * CreateGeometry(
00315         GisIEnvelope * envelope) = 0;

00346     /// LinearRing
00347 
00348     /// \brief
00349     ///  Creates a LinearRing object by copying from a collection of positions.
00350     /// 
00351     /// \remarks
00352     ///  The first and last positions must be equal.
00353     /// 
00354     /// \param positions 
00355     /// Input collection of positions to copy
00356     /// 
00357     /// \return
00358     /// Returns a LinearRing
00359     /// 
00360     GISGEOM_API virtual GisILinearRing* CreateLinearRing(
00361         GisDirectPositionCollection* positions) = 0;
00362 
00363     /// \brief
00364     ///  Creates a LinearRing object by copying from an array of ordinates.
00365     /// 
00366     /// \remarks
00367     ///  The ordinates representing the first and last positions must be equal.
00368     /// 
00369     /// \param dimensionality 
00370     /// Input dimensionality of the ordinates (see GisDimensionality)
00371     /// \param numOrdinates 
00372     /// Input total number of ordinates in the array
00373     /// \param ordinates 
00374     /// Input ordinate array representing positions
00375     /// 
00376     /// \return
00377     /// Returns a LinearRing
00378     /// 
00379     GISGEOM_API virtual GisILinearRing* CreateLinearRing(
00380         GisInt32 dimensionality, 
00381         GisInt32 numOrdinates,
